main event: A witness observed several bright red lights moving in various directions in Kettering, Ohio on 10 September 1959.
interesting points: The lights were described as brighter than most stars and blinked on and off.,Witnesses indicated that the objects could have been blinking lights of an aircraft.,The sighting lasted for about 2-3 minutes.,The objects appeared to move up, down, and sideways before fading from sight.,The sighting occurred during twilight when many aircraft were passing overhead.
witness description: One witness was a 14-year-old student, and another was with them at the time of sighting.
